channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023100581
item.description:
Report X-2023100581

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: MANKATO
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100581 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED. 2. X-2023100582 SequenceEvent: package was found wet while unloaded. upon inspection we found there was dry ice in the package and it was not properly marked DescribePack: dry ice inside package melted and caused the box to become wet DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the shipper needs to declare Dry Ice and have it marked when shipping. 3. X-2023100823 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED.

item.title: Report X-2023100570
item.description:
Report X-2023100570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: driver noticed around 11:30am that his van had a leaking hazmat. he placed it in a plastic bag and moved it away from other packages, then brought it back to the station at the end of his route. QA admins learned of the damaged hazmat upon driver return and responded, performing in-house cleanup in the van and placing the damaged package and cleanup material in a lined tote. brought it back to damage area, moved to drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. van driver placed it in plastic bag and moved it away from other packages till he could return to station at end of route.

item.title: Report X-2023100012
item.description:
Report X-2023100012

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment was suspected to contain batteries after the shipper asked the courier if he had taken the battery package. After returning and offloading, the manager opened the box and discovered 57 Apple MagSafe Battery Packs. The MagSafe Battery Pack has a 7.62V, 11.13Wh battery inside, delivering 1460 mAh of charge. Model# A2384, MJWY3AM/A. There was no release. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023100299
item.description:
Report X-2023100299

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was loaded into a van this morning on the inbound. shortly afterward, someone noticed that the package was leaking. they had QA come place it in a lined tote and bring it to the damage area, where it was moved to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats.

item.title: Report X-2023100246
item.description:
Report X-2023100246

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found lying damp on its side in front of the van. HAP specialist processed it and righted it, assuming the liquid was from the rain. an hour later, another QA admin brought it to the damage area suspecting damage. HESS specialist checked using a pH strip and found that it turned red for acidity. They opened up the package and found that it had leaked while on its side. The placed it in a lined tote and brought it to the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: One bottle leaked due to loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023100386
item.description:
Report X-2023100386

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP AROUND 1:30 AM, FROM DOOR 33 ON THE UNLOAD, BY THE RESPONDER. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN, THREE, 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF ALPHA 90 IA FLUX, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN3284, CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S. (HYDROCHLORIC ACID, ZINC CHLORIDE), 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X3 GALLONS). THE CAPS ON TWO OF THE THREE BOTTLES, WHERE LOOSE, WHICH ALLOWED A LARGE AMOUNT OF THE ACID TO LEAK FROM BOTH BOTTLES WITH LOOSE CAPS. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP, ALONG WITH CARBOARD FROM SEVERAL OTHER BOXES WHICH WHERE AROUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023090833
item.description:
Report X-2023090833

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
